brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the monetary value of patient-centrednes in health
      care by determining a willingness-to-pay for more patient-centredness care for both patients
      and health insurers

clinical_study.brief_title: Willingness to Pay for Patient-centred Care

detailed_description.textblock:
We perform our study in the area of fertility care, as it is known that infertile patients
      suffer from a high physical and physiological burden during treatment and could especially
      benefit from patient-centred care. Moreover, previous studies have clearly identified the
      concept of patient-centred fertility care and have shown that improvement is needed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients undergoing MAR-treatment (ovulation induction, intra-uterine inseminations,
             in vitro fertilization, or intra-cytoplasmic sperm injection)

          -  All healthcare purchasers working at one of the 5 large Dutch health insurer
             companies.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  None

study_pop.textblock:
Patient who are under treatment for their fertility problem and underwent at least one
        treatment in one of 10 Dutch clinics.

        All healthcare purchasers from the 5 large Dutch health insurer companies

clinical_study.official_title: Identifying Patients' and Healht Insurers' Preferences Regarding Patient-centred Care by Determining Their Willingness-to-pay for Patient-centred Care

primary_outcome.description: A willingness-to-pay for patient-centred care for both patients and health insurers

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
